messages.message:
To automate the process a bit moving forward, I created a Release Notes Markdown generator @john :

https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/9639

Provided the instructions on how we can use it here:

# Step 1: Generate the csv of PRs given a time window
#
# make build runlocal START_DATE=2019/04/14 END_DATE=2019/04/16
#
# Step 2:
#
# Upload to Google Sheets, have everybody review and edit the
# spreadsheet, to ensure that all columns are filled out appropriately
#
# Download that spreadsheet when done and copy it to the “history” folder here.
#
# Step 3: Generate a first-pass of the Markdown for the Release Coordinator to edit
#
#  make build generate-markdown FILEPATH=history/out-2019-04-18_20_29-annotated.csv

For example, it created this file (from our release notes CSV today)

Next step will be to create a standard for eng to provide the three pieces of information in their PR, e.g., “is it noteworthy”, “release notes section” and “release notes description”

Then Ashish can’t ask me for release notes again and I’ll just point him to a script :slightly_smiling_face:
